translations.text: Qaf. By the glorious Qur'an.<sup foot_note="181545">1</sup>
Nay; they wondered that a warner should have come to them from among themselves.<sup foot_note="181546">1</sup> The unbelievers said: “This indeed is a strange thing.
What! When we are dead and reduced to mere dust, (shall we be raised to life)? Such a return is far-fetched.”<sup foot_note="181547">1</sup>
(Thus do they imagine, although) We know well what the earth takes away from them. With Us is a Record that preserves everything.<sup foot_note="181548">1</sup>
They gave the lie to the Truth when it came to them. So they are now in a state of great perplexity.<sup foot_note="181549">1</sup>
Did they<sup foot_note="181550">1</sup> never observe the sky above them: how We built it and beautified it;<sup foot_note="181551">2</sup> and it has no cracks;<sup foot_note="181552">3</sup>
and We have spread out the earth, and have set upon it firm mountains, and have caused it to bring out plants of all beauteous kinds?<sup foot_note="181553">1</sup>
All these are to serve as eye openers and as a lesson to every being who is prone to turn (to the Truth).
We also sent down blessed water from the heaven, wherewith We caused gardens and harvest-grain to grow,
and tall palm-trees with their thickly-clustered spathes;

all this as sustenance for Our servants. And thus We do bring the dead land back to life with water.<sup foot_note="181554">1</sup> Such shall be the coming forth (of human beings from the earth).<sup foot_note="181555">2</sup>
In the past Noah's people, and the people of Rass<sup foot_note="181556">1</sup> and Thamud gave the lie (to Messengers),
and so did 'Ad, and Pharaoh<sup foot_note="181557">1</sup> and Lot's brethren,
and the people of Aykah, and the people of Tubba'. They all gave the lie to the Messengers. Thereafter My threat of chastisement against them was fulfilled.
Did We, then, become worn out by the first creation? Not at all; but they are in doubt about a fresh creation.<sup foot_note="181558">1</sup>
Surely We<sup foot_note="181559">1</sup> have created man, and We know the promptings of his heart, and We are nearer to him than even his jugular vein.<sup foot_note="181560">2</sup>
Moreover, there are two scribes, one each sitting on the right and the left, recording everything.
He utters not a word, but there is a vigilant watcher at hand.<sup foot_note="181561">1</sup>
Lo, the agony of death has indeed come with the Truth.<sup foot_note="181562">1</sup> That is what you had sought to avoid.<sup foot_note="181563">2</sup>
And then the Trumpet was blown.<sup foot_note="181564">1</sup> This is the day of the promised chastisement.
Everyone has come, each attended by one who will drive him on, and another who will bear witness.<sup foot_note="181565">1</sup>
You were heedless of this. Now We have removed your veil and so your vision today is sharp.<sup foot_note="181566">1</sup>
His companion said:“ Here is he who was in my charge.”<sup foot_note="181567">1</sup>
The command was given: “Cast into Hell<sup foot_note="181568">1</sup> every hardened, stubborn unbeliever,<sup foot_note="181569">2</sup>
who hinders good,<sup foot_note="181570">1</sup> exceeds the limits,<sup foot_note="181571">2</sup> is immersed in doubts,<sup foot_note="181572">3</sup>
and has set up another deity with Allah. Hurl him into the grievous torment.”<sup foot_note="181573">1</sup>
His companion said:“ I did not incite him to rebel; he was far gone into error of his own accord.”<sup foot_note="181574">1</sup>
(It was said): “Do not remonstrate in My presence. I had warned you.<sup foot_note="181575">1</sup>
My Word is not changed;<sup foot_note="181576">1</sup> and never do I inflict the least wrong upon My servants.”<sup foot_note="181577">2</sup>
On that Day We shall ask Hell: “Are you full?” And it will reply: “Are there any more?”<sup foot_note="181578">1</sup>
And when Paradise shall be brought close to the God-fearing, and will no longer be far away,<sup foot_note="181579">1</sup>
it will be said: “This is what you were promised, a promise made to everyone who turned much (to Allah)<sup foot_note="181580">1</sup> and was watchful of his conduct,<sup foot_note="181581">2</sup>

to everyone who feared the Merciful One though He is beyond the reach of perception,<sup foot_note="181582">1</sup> to everyone who has come with a heart ever wont to turn (to Him).<sup foot_note="181583">2</sup>
Enter this Paradise in peace.”<sup foot_note="181584">1</sup> That will be the Day of Eternity.
Therein they shall get whatever they desire; and with Us there is even more.<sup foot_note="181585">1</sup>

How many a nation did We destroy before them that were stronger in prowess than these. They searched about the lands of the world.<sup foot_note="181586">1</sup> But could they find a refuge?<sup foot_note="181587">2</sup>
Verily there is a lesson in this for everyone who has a (sound) heart and who listens with an attentive mind.<sup foot_note="181588">1</sup>
We created the heavens and the earth and all that is between them in six days,<sup foot_note="181589">1</sup> and weariness did not even touch Us.
Hence bear with patience whatever they say,<sup foot_note="181590">1</sup> and celebrate your Lord's glory before the rising of the sun and before its setting;
and in the night, too, celebrate His glory, in the wake of prostration.<sup foot_note="181591">1</sup>
Hearken on the Day when the caller will call from a place nearby,<sup foot_note="181592">1</sup>
the Day when they shall hear the Blast in truth. That will be the Day (for the dead) to come forth.<sup foot_note="181593">1</sup>
Surely it is We Who give life and cause death, and to Us shall all return
on the Day when the earth will be rent asunder and people, rising from it, will hasten forth. To assemble them all will be easy for Us.<sup foot_note="181594">1</sup>

(O Prophet), We are well aware of what they say;<sup foot_note="181595">1</sup> and you are not required to force things on them. So exhort with the Qur'an all those who fear My warning.<sup foot_note="181596">2</sup>
